FinOps 简而言之

FinOps 代表了一种战略转变，它将技术、财务和业务实践相结合，以提高效率并优化云计算基础设施的财务绩效。

鉴于云计算对许多公司来说构成了巨大的运营支出，越来越多的企业正在采用 FinOps。通过促进云成本的共担责任，公司可以全面了解其云支出，从而优化这些成本、实现利润最大化并增强竞争优势。

FinOps 基金会将这一概念描述为不断发展的云财务管理学科和文化实践，使组织能够通过帮助工程、财务、技术和业务团队协作制定数据驱动的支出决策，实现最大的业务价值。

本质上，FinOps 指的是一种纪律和文化心态，鼓励组织内不同部门之间的协作以优化 IT 支出。参与 FinOps 的主要团队是财务部门和 DevOps 团队。这种跨职能对话旨在通过平衡速度、成本和质量，同时仔细考虑云支出对整体结果的影响，最大限度地提高云服务的价值。在 FinOps 中，有关云支出的每一项决策都会通过数据驱动的决策流程进行评估，重点关注优化、成本预测和成本分配。
通过采用 FinOps，组织不仅可以简化其业务流程云财务管理，还培养透明度和协作文化，从而实现更好的财务成果并提高业务价值。

GreenOps 和 FinOps 之间的协同作用是什么？

虽然 FinOps 和 GreenOps 是不同的方法，但它们无缝协作，帮助公司优化云使用和成本，同时减少环境足迹。通过整合这两种策略，企业可以实现财务效率和可持续性。 FinOps 是 GreenOps 的关键组成部分。通过确保云资源的最佳利用，企业不仅可以节省成本，还可以减少能源消耗和碳排放，实现双赢。这种协同作用使 FinOps 成为旨在加强可持续发展努力的公司的重要框架。

FinOps 专注于监控 IT 支出和云相关费用，而 GreenOps 则跟踪基础设施的碳足迹，无论是完全基于云还是混合模型。尽管目标不同，但这两种方法是相互关联的，尤其是在完整的云环境中，其共同目标是通过适当的规模优化云资源。

例如，功能更强大的虚拟机实例不仅成本更高，而且需要更多电力，从而导致更高的排放。这种相关性凸显了整合 FinOps 和 GreenOps 的必要性，以有效平衡成本、排放和电力需求。

从高层角度来看，GreenOps 和 FinOps 看起来非常相似，都拥有高效云使用的最终目标。实现最高效率可带来两个主要成果：降低成本和减少碳排放。相同的 FinOps 实践（例如调整规模、存储分层、删除闲置和未连接的资源以及安排计算关闭时间）也适用于 GreenOps，以减少碳排放。在 AWS re:Invent 的闭幕词中，Werner Vogels 强调了这种联系，指出成本是可持续性的密切代表，并申明FinOps 和 GreenOps 之间紧密结合的关系。

通过了解和实施 FinOps 和 GreenOps，组织可以更好地管理其云资源、削减成本，同时最大限度地减少对环境的影响。这种双重方法不仅满足监管和客户对可持续发展的期望，而且使公司成为企业社会责任的领导者。

将理论付诸实践：现实场景

想象一个场景，软件交付管道中通常使用的所有环境（开发、登台和生产）都在相同的基础设施上使用相同数量的 Pod 运行，每个 Pod 都有重叠的计算需求。 通过在工作时间之外保持开发和暂存环境处于活动状态，我们最终在每周 168 个小时中的 128 个小时中使用了不必要的资源。这意味着使用量比必要的多了大约 103%。实际上，工程师只有大约 23% 的时间使用这些环境，这凸显了许多工程公司的严重资源浪费。

幸运的是，解决这种效率低下的问题很简单。通过几行配置并安装名为 kube‑green 的 Kubernetes Operator，我们可以大大减少资源浪费。 Kube-green 是 Kubernetes 的一个附加组件，它使用称为 CRD SleepInfo 的简单配置自动关闭不必要的资源并根据需要重新启动它们。

考虑一个管理 75 个命名空间的集群，我们的目标是在工作时间之外暂停 48 个命名空间（我们的开发和临时环境），同时保持名为 api-gateway 的部署处于活动状态。如果没有 kube-green，该集群运行大约 1050 个 Pod，分配 75 GB 内存和 45 个 CPU，消耗 45 GB 内存和 4.5 个 CPU。这种使用方式每周会产生约 222 公斤的二氧化碳排放量。
通过使用 kube-green 配置 SleepInfo，我们可以将 pod 总数减少 600 个，使其减少到 450 个。分配的资源减少到 30 GB 内存和 15 GB CPU。实际资源消耗减少至 21 GB 内存和 1 个 CPU，每周二氧化碳排放量减少至约 139 公斤。

在该集群上使用 kube-green 一周，二氧化碳排放量减少了 83 公斤，与正常运行相比减少了 38%。 一年多以来，这相当于减少了约 4000 公斤二氧化碳。这不仅有利于环境，而且还可以显着节省成本。大多数云提供商根据使用的节点数量收费，因此在非工作时间减少节点数量会降低运营成本国家成本。

实施 kube-green 具有双重优势：环境可持续性和财务节省。通过优化资源使用和减少排放，企业可以实现更高效、更具成本效益的云基础设施。

总结

将 FinOps 实践与 GreenOps 一起采用，使我们能够利用成本作为 GreenOps 实施的驱动力，使业务效益与环境优势保持一致。借助 kube-green 等工具，我们可以将 GreenOps 策略无缝集成到现有的工作负载管理中，从而对基础设施成本和可持续性产生积极影响。

GreenOps 和 FinOps 是紧密相连的概念。通常，当我们从可持续发展的角度优化资源时，我们还会节省云费用。为了做出明智的决策，了解集群的成本及其二氧化碳当量排放量至关重要。许多成本监控工具（例如 OpenCost）现在除了跟踪碳成本排放量之外，还包括碳成本排放跟踪云支出。

通过结合利用 FinOps 和 GreenOps，我们可以提高运营效率并减少环境足迹，而无需对工作负载管理方式进行重大改变。 kube-green 等工具可在非高峰时段自动缩减资源，确保我们只使用必要的东西。这不仅最大限度地减少能源消耗和排放，而且还可以节省大量成本，因为大多数云服务提供商根据资源使用情况收费。

深入了解财务和环境指标，使组织能够做出数据驱动的决策，从而造福于利润和地球。提供成本和碳排放综合视图的监控工具可帮助企业平衡效率与可持续性，加强 FinOps 和 GreenOps 之间的共生关系。

本质上，将 FinOps 与 GreenOps 相结合有助于我们创建更具可持续性和成本效益的云基础设施，在推动业务成功的同时促进环境责任。

item.title: 【Lessons from CrowdStrike’s buggy update: the critical importance of robust release processes】CrowdStrike 错误更新的教训：稳健的发布流程至关重要
item.description:
【

Community post by Andrés Vega, M42 and Technical Leader, CNCF TAG Security

Recent events involving CrowdStrike’s Falcon security software have underscored a critical lesson across the industry: the importance of having a robust, secure release process. Such incidents serve as reminder of the consequences that can result from issues in software updates. These consequences can affect a wide range of critical industries and services, from government agencies and financial institutions to healthcare systems and emergency services.

The Incident

On July 18, 2024, a buggy update to CrowdStrike’s Falcon security software caused widespread system crashes across their customer base. Windows-based systems experienced a Blue Screen of Death (BSOD), the kernel panic of Windows systems, leading to significant disruptions in critical services, including government agencies, banks, airlines, payment processors, 911 call centers, television networks, and health systems.

The aftermath of this incident has been challenging, with organizations scrambling to implement fixes ranging from simple reboots to complex recovery procedures involving encrypted disks. This situation highlights the need for more robust safeguards in the software release process.

Justin Cappos, Professor at NYU and co-creator of in-toto, expressed his shock at the incident:

“It strains credibility that any organization, much less a security company, would fail to have robust software supply chain validation mechanisms in place. The fact that software could be released without testing demonstrates a level of negligence, I’m shocked to see from a major security company.”

This statement underscores the gravity of the situation and the critical need for robust software supply chain validation in all organizations, especially those dealing with critical security software.

The Self-Inflicted Ransomware Comparison

One particularly concerning aspect of this incident was highlighted by cryptography and infrastructure engineer Tony Arcieri on Mastodon. He drew a comparison between the situation and a self inflicted a ransomware attack:

This comparison underscores the critical importance of not just having robust release processes, but also maintaining proper key management practices. Without access to these recovery keys, organizations find themselves in a situation where they can’t access their own encrypted data – mimicking the effects of a ransomware attack, but caused by their own security measures.

The Need for Robust Release Processes

This incident emphasizes the critical need for robust release processes that are not just guidelines, but technically enforced safeguards. As Cappos points out:

“Release processes aren’t just a checklist of best practices. They should be enforced technically in a way that makes it implausible to bypass these safeguards. This technical enforcement is key to preventing incidents like the one we are seeing.”

With this in mind, let’s explore the critical components of a robust release process:

  1. Comprehensive Testing: Thorough testing of updates in environments that closely mimic production systems.
  2. Integrity Verification: Use cryptographic techniques to verify the integrity of each step in the release process, ensuring that no authorized changes can be made without detection.
  3. Staged Rollouts: Implementing gradual rollout strategies to detect issues before they affect a wide user base.
  4. Quick Rollback Mechanisms: The ability to swiftly revert to a previous stable version when issues are detected.
  5. Transparent Communication: Clear, timely communication with affected users about the nature of the problem and steps for resolution.
  6. Proper Key Management: Ensure that encryption keys and recovery keys are properly managed and readily available when needed.

By enforcing these processes in software, organizations can create more robust systems where it becomes extremely difficult, if not impossible, to release software updates without going through all the necessary security checks and balances.

in-toto: The Blueprint for Secure and Verifiable Software Updates

At the CNCF Security Advisory Group, we strongly advocate for the adoption of frameworks that can help prevent such incidents. One such framework is in-toto, which provides a comprehensive approach to supply chain security.

What is in-toto?

in-toto is an open-source framework that cryptographically ensures the integrity of the software supply chain. It allows for the definition of supply chain layouts and the creation of cryptographically verifiable metadata about the steps in the chain.

An in-toto layout specifies: 

  1. The steps that should occur in the software supply chain
  2. The order in which these steps should happen, these will be enforced as verification procedures to be carried out on the final product.
  3. Who is authorized to perform each step through the use of cryptographic keys.
  4. What materials (input) each step should use and what products (output) it should generate, as well as thresholds  Determine how many signatures are required for a step to be considered valid.

Example of a Simple in-toto Layout

Here’s a simplified example of what an in-toto layout might look like for a basic software release process:

Santiago Torres-Arias, co-creator of in-toto and Assistant Professor at Purdue University, expounds the depth of assurance that in-toto provides.

“Supply chain integrity is not just about securing the ‘what’ of software. Only by answering ‘how’ something was made can you be really sure of its integrity. That is where in-toto shines — it enables automated security and compliance checks throughout the entire software supply chain, ensuring not just the end product, but every step of its creation is verifiable and secure.”

This comprehensive approach to software supply chain integrity is crucial in preventing widespread outages from software updates. By verifying each step of the development and release process, in-toto provides a framework for catching potential issues before they can impact end-users. 

How in-toto Layouts Could Help Prevent Incidents Like the CrowdStrike Update Issue

  1. Enforced Process: By defining a clear layout, in-toto ensures that all required steps in the release process are followed, reducing the chance of skipping crucial steps like thorough testing.
  2. Verification of Inputs and Outputs: Each step’s materials and products are verified, ensuring that unexpected changes aren’t introduced during the process.
  3. Authorized Actions: By specifying who can perform each action, in-toto reduces the risk of unauthorized or accidental changes to the software.
  4. Auditability: The layout provides a clear record of what should happen in the release process, making it easier to audit and identify potential issues.
  5. Final Product Verification: The inspection step ensures that the final product meets all specified criteria before release.

By implementing in-toto with a well-designed layout along with comprehensive testing procedures, gating criteria, and gradual rolllouts, organizations can significantly reduce the risk of releasing buggy updates, thereby preventing incidents similar to the CrowdStrike update issue.

Priyanka Sharma, Executive Director of CNCF emphasizes the importance of maintaining integrity in software update systems:

“The recent incident with CrowdStrike’s software update serves as a stark reminder of the critical importance of secure software supply chains in our increasingly interconnected digital world. At CNCF, we’ve long advocated for the adoption of robust security practices and tools throughout the entire software lifecycle. This event underscores the need for comprehensive, end-to-end security measures that go beyond traditional approaches. It’s why we support projects like in-toto, which provides a framework for ensuring the integrity of the software supply chain. As we move forward, it’s imperative that organizations not only implement best practices but also leverage cutting-edge tools and frameworks to prevent such incidents. The security of our digital infrastructure is a shared responsibility, and CNCF is committed to fostering the development and adoption of technologies that enhance the security and reliability of the cloud native ecosystem.”

Conclusion

The recent CrowdStrike incident serves as a powerful reminder of the critical importance of secure, robust release processes in software systems that people rely on in their daily lives. By learning from this event and implementing frameworks like in-toto, we can work towards preventing similar incidents in the future, ensuring the stability and security of the software we all rely on.

As the CNCF Security Advisory Group, we urge all organizations to take this opportunity to review and enhance their release processes. The security of our digital infrastructure depends on our collective commitment to best practices in software development and deployment.

最近涉及 CrowdStrike 的 Falcon 安全软件的事件强调了整个行业的一个重要教训：拥有强大、安全的发布流程的重要性。此类事件提醒人们软件更新问题可能导致的后果。这些后果可能会影响广泛的关键行业和服务，从政府机构和金融机构到医疗保健系统和紧急服务。

事件

2024 年 7 月 18 日，CrowdStrike 的 Falcon 安全软件的错误更新导致其客户群出现广泛的系统崩溃。基于 Windows 的系统经历了蓝屏死机 (BSOD)，这是 Windows 系统的内核恐慌，导致关键服务严重中断，包括政府机构、银行、航空公司、支付处理器、911 呼叫中心、电视网络和医疗系统.

此事件的后果极具挑战性，各组织都在争先恐后地实施修复措施，从简单的重新启动到涉及加密磁盘的复杂恢复过程。这种情况凸显了在软件发布过程中需要更强大的保障措施。

纽约大学教授、in-toto 联合创始人 Justin Cappos 表达了他对这一事件的震惊：

“任何组织（更不用说安全公司）都无法建立强大的软件供应链验证机制，这会降低可信度。软件未经测试就发布的事实表明了一定程度的疏忽，我很震惊地看到一家大型安全公司。”

此声明强调了情况的严重性以及所有组织（尤其是那些处理关键安全软件的组织）对强大软件供应链验证的迫切需求。

自我造成的勒索软件比较

密码学和基础设施工程师 Tony Arcieri 在 Mastodon 上强调了这一事件的一个特别令人担忧的方面。他将这种情况与自己遭受的勒索软件攻击进行了比较：

这一比较强调了不仅拥有强大的发布流程，而且维护适当的密钥管理实践的至关重要性。如果无法访问这些恢复密钥，组织就会发现自己无法访问自己的加密数据——模仿勒索软件攻击的效果，但却是由他们自己的安全措施造成的s。

需要强大的发布流程

此事件强调了对强大的发布流程的迫切需要，该流程不仅是指导方针，而且是技术上强制执行的保障措施。正如卡波斯指出的：

“发布流程不仅仅是最佳实践清单。它们应该在技术上以一种不可能绕过这些保障措施的方式实施。这种技术执行对于防止类似我们所看到的事件的发生至关重要。”

考虑到这一点，让我们探讨一下稳健的发布流程的关键组成部分：

  • 全面测试：在密切模仿生产系统的环境中对更新进行全面测试。
  • 完整性验证：使用加密技术来验证发布过程中每个步骤的完整性，确保不会在未经检测的情况下进行任何授权更改。
  • 分阶段推出：实施逐步推出策略，以便在问题影响广泛的用户群之前发现问题。
  • 快速回滚机制：检测到问题时能够快速恢复到之前的稳定版本。
  • 透明沟通：与受影响的用户就问题的性质和解决步骤进行清晰、及时的沟通。
  • 正确的密钥管理：确保加密密钥和恢复密钥得到正确管理并在需要时随时可用。

    • 通过在软件中实施这些流程，组织可以创建更强大的系统，在这种系统中，如果不是不可能，在不经过所有必要的安全检查和平衡的情况下发布软件更新将变得极其困难。

    整体：安全且可验证的软件更新蓝图

    在 CNCF 安全咨询小组，我们强烈主张采用有助于防止此类事件的框架。 in-toto 就是这样一个框架，它提供了一种全面的供应链安全方法。

    什么是 in-toto？

    in-toto 是一个开源框架，可以通过加密方式确保软件供应链的完整性。它允许定义供应链布局并创建有关链中步骤的可加密验证的元数据。

    整体布局指定：

  • 软件供应链中应发生的步骤
  • 这些步骤发生的顺序，将作为对最终产品执行的验证程序来强制执行。
  • 谁有权通过使用加密密钥执行每个步骤。
  • 每个步骤应使用哪些材料（输入）以及应生成哪些产品（输出）以及阈值确定签名数量需要一个步骤才能被视为有效。

    • 简单的整体布局示例

    以下是基本软件发布流程的整体布局的简化示例：

    圣地亚哥·托雷斯-阿里亚斯 (Santiago Torres-Arias)，in-toto 和普渡大学助理教授阐述了 in-toto 提供的深度保证。

    “供应链完整性不仅仅是保护软件的‘内容’。只有回答某物是“如何”制造的，你才能真正确定它的完整性。这就是 intoto 的闪光点——它可以在整个软件供应链中实现自动安全性和合规性检查，不仅确保最终产品，而且确保其创建的每一步都是可验证和安全的。”

    这种确保软件供应链完整性的综合方法对于防止软件更新造成的大范围中断至关重要。通过验证开发和发布过程的每个步骤，in-toto 提供了一个框架，用于在潜在问题影响最终用户之前捕获它们。 

    整体布局如何帮助防止 CrowdStrike 更新问题等事件

  • 强制流程：通过定义清晰的布局，in-toto 可确保遵循发布流程中的所有必需步骤，从而减少跳过全面测试等关键步骤的机会。
  • 验证输入和输出：验证每个步骤的材料和产品，确保在此过程中不会引入意外的变化。
  • 授权操作：通过指定谁可以执行每项操作，in-toto 可以降低未经授权或意外更改软件的风险。
  • 可审核性：该布局清晰地记录了发布过程中应该发生的情况，从而更容易审核和识别潜在问题。
  • 最终产品验证：检查步骤可确保最终产品在发布前符合所有指定标准。

    • 通过全面实施精心设计的布局以及全面的测试程序、限制标准和逐步推出，组织可以显着降低发布有错误的更新的风险，从而防止发生类似于 CrowdStrike 更新问题的事件。

    CNCF 执行董事 Priyanka Sharma 强调保持软件更新系统完整性的重要性：

    “最近发生的 CrowdStrike 软件更新事件清楚地提醒我们，在我们日益互联的数字世界中，安全的软件供应链至关重要。在 CNCF，我们长期以来一直主张在整个软件生命周期中采用强大的安全实践和工具。这一事件强调需要超越传统方法的全面、端到端的安全措施。这就是为什么我们支持像 in-toto 这样的项目，它提供了一个确保软件供应链完整性的框架。随着我们的前进，组织不仅必须实施最佳实践，还要利用尖端的工具和框架来防止此类事件的发生。我们数字基础设施的安全这是一项共同的责任，CNCF 致力于促进增强云原生生态系统安全性和可靠性的技术的开发和采用。”

    结论

    最近的 CrowdStrike 事件有力地提醒人们，在人们日常生活所依赖的软件系统中，安全、稳健的发布流程至关重要。通过从这次事件中吸取教训并实施像 in-toto 这样的框架，我们可以努力防止未来发生类似事件，确保我们所依赖的软件的稳定性和安全性。

    作为 CNCF 安全咨询小组，我们敦促所有组织借此机会审查和增强其发布流程。我们数字基础设施的安全取决于我们对软件开发和部署最佳实践的集体承诺。

item.title: 【Building a zero CVE strategy】制定零 CVE 策略
item.description:
【

Member post originally published on the Kubesimplify blog by Kunal Verma

With the increase in software complexity and as digital threats evolve (as discussed in our previous blog) in today’s digital age, the organizations are facing a massive increase in number of security vulnerabilities. According to the Coalition Cyber Threat Index 2024, we can expect a 25% rise in Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs), reaching almost 34,888 this year – which is an astounding number!

Such a rise in CVEs presents a significant challenge for IT professionals who must constantly identify, prioritize, and remediate these vulnerabilities. This process, often pretty overwhelming, is commonly termed as “CVE Fatigue” and can lead to missed vulnerabilities and an increased risk of cyberattacks.

In this blog, we will delve into the primary causes of CVE fatigue and discuss some actionable strategies to minimize CVE fatigue. Thus, guiding organizations towards a more controlled and secure environment.

What is CVE Fatigue?

If you’re not already familiar with the term CVEs, it stands for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures. These are standardized identifiers for known software and hardware vulnerabilities. The purpose of the CVE system is to provide a standardized way to identify and describe vulnerabilities, making it easier for organizations to prioritize and address security issues.

For more detailed information on CVEs, you can refer to the article.

CVE Fatigue on the other hand is a common term which is used to describe the overwhelming feeling experienced by developers and IT professionals due to the constant influx of new CVEs being introduced in the industry, that require immediate attention. This constant flow of discovering new vulnerabilities and quickly remediating them can lead to burnout and overlooked issues, increasing the risk of security breaches.

A notable incident that illustrates the consequences of CVE fatigue is the 2017 Equifax data breach. In this breach, attackers exploited a known vulnerability (CVE-2017-5638) in the Apache Struts framework. Although a patch for this vulnerability had been available for months, it was not applied in time, leading to the exposure of sensitive personal information of approximately 147.9 million individuals.

The Equifax breach is one of the prime examples of CVE fatigue because the company’s security team was likely overwhelmed by the sheer volume of vulnerabilities needing attention, which led to the delay in patching a critical vulnerability. This incident underscores the importance of effective vulnerability management and the dire consequences of CVE fatigue.

Did you know?
According to the IBM Cost of a Data Breach Report 2023, the global average cost of a data breach in 2023 was $4.45 million, a 15% increase over three years. This certainly highlights the financial impact of CVE breaches and the importance of addressing CVE fatigue to prevent such costly incidents and most importantly – the customer’s trust!

Keep reading

  • Understand the anatomy of a CVE
  • How Grafana Security used Dapr to improve vulnerability scans
  • Why OSS security matters
  • Register for KubeCon + CloudNativeCon North American 2024 today

Proven Strategies to Reduce CVE Fatigue

CVE fatigue is a significant challenge for many organizations, arising from several key issues. By understanding the root causes and applying proven strategies, we can effectively mitigate this issue.

Use Minimal Dependencies

The sheer number of CVEs published each year can overwhelm security teams. With thousands of new vulnerabilities to assess and address, security teams are overwhelmed with alerts that require immediate attention. This high volume makes it difficult to keep up, leading to delayed responses and potential oversights.

Check out the CVE statistics and facts report for more information on the rise of CVEs between 2019-2024.

Reducing the number of dependencies from the start can significantly decrease the number of potential vulnerabilities. For many companies and distributions, the common practice is to start with a general-purpose Linux image and strip away the things that aren’t needed.

Note: This is what DockerSlim does by taking an existing image and removing unnecessary components.

While this approach results in a smaller version of the main distribution, such as Ubuntu minimal, a more efficient way is to add only the necessary dependencies from the start. You can use minimal base images like Distroless for this purpose, but it isn’t straightforward to add or remove OS packages with this approach. Even a small dependency can cause a significant breach! And, if a developer doesn’t find a package they need in these minimal images, they often switch to much larger images instead of adding just the OS package they need.

Talos Linux, which includes only 12 binaries compared to other systems with hundreds, is a great example of this strategy, as its designed from scratch to include only what is needed. This approach limits the attack surface and reduces the burden on security teams.

Note: If you’re wondering how to have complete control over the OS packages your app needs, check out BuildSafe to get started.

Have a Dependency Update Mechanism

Effective management of software dependencies is critical in addressing CVE fatigue and minimizing vulnerabilities. Using a declarative format for dependencies helps eliminate implicit behavior problems. Declarative dependency management makes it clear which dependencies are being used, making it easier to track and update them. By explicitly declaring all dependencies in configuration files, teams can easily manage and automate updates, ensuring that all components are up-to-date and secure. Tools like Dependabot automate this process by checking for outdated dependencies and creating pull requests to update them.

However, it’s important to note that Dependabot cannot handle OS package updates because projects don’t typically have OS dependencies defined declaratively. This inconsistency makes it hard to track and update them, leading to unnoticed security vulnerabilities. Furthermore, very few package managers, such as Nix, declaratively define OS dependencies per project, making this an ongoing challenge in dependency management.

Note: The team at BuildSafe is working on a GitHub bot to address this issue for OS dependencies. If you’re interested, you can join the Discord server to request access to the alpha version!

Did you know?
Repology, a project that tracks packaging information across many repositories, shows the fragmentation in package management. This fragmentation highlights how different repositories handle packages and the inefficiencies of using multiple package managers.

It’s worth noting that Nix stands out for having one of the largest package ecosystems with the least potential CVEs, highlighting its robustness and security!

Use a Single Package Manager and Automated Patching

Managing multiple package ecosystems can overwhelm security teams, leading to inefficiencies and delayed patching.

Enforcing the use of a single package manager across an organization simplifies dependency management. A single package manager provides a unified ecosystem, making it easier for security teams to track and update dependencies. For instance, when there’s a CVE out and the security team is responsible for patching mission-critical software, they often need to send patches to the upstream package repository. Imagine if you and your team had to do this for five different package ecosystems, each with its own build recipes and specific requirements, because of a single CVE – what a nightmare!

Ideally, as companies grow, the aim should be to have an internal package registry where dependencies are vetted by the security team before being used by developers. These internal repositories can mirror public ones while adding and maintaining additional packages with security checks and automated update strategies. This approach not only reduces the complexity and workload for security teams but also ensures that all dependencies are consistently managed and secure.

Thoughts:
Imagine the benefits if we could share a package manager across both our development and runtime environments. Nix, a powerful package manager allows us to do this, but more on that in a future article.

For instance, Wolfi by Chainguard is a good example here. Wolfi is a distribution focused on being CVE-free and has achieved the status of Docker Trusted Publisher.

Prioritize Vulnerability Management

Determining which vulnerabilities to address first can be complex, as not all CVEs pose the same level of risk. The importance of the affected systems, potential impact, and severity need to be considered.

You can prioritize vulnerabilities by requesting Vulnerability Exploitability eXchange (VEX) documents from security advisories within your package manager ecosystem. These documents help eliminate bogus CVEs and provides accurate information about vulnerabilities. VEX documents can be generated using tools like Kubescape, which utilizes eBPF to monitor syscalls and determine the relevance of specific CVEs.

An example of how a VEX document looks like is given below:COPYCOPY

{
  "@context": "https://openvex.dev/ns/v0.2.0",
  "@id": "https://openvex.dev/docs/public/vex-adc52fe6c8d2ba0feee7f4343f9b40c90e8cdb077817f880a6650502aece82bc",
  "author": "Unknown Author",
  "timestamp": "2023-10-07T23:32:07.620932-08:00",
  "version": 1,
  "statements": [
    {
      "vulnerability": {
        "name": "CVE-2014-123456"
      },
      "timestamp": "2023-10-07T23:32:07.620932-08:00",
      "products": [
        {
          "@id": "pkg:apk/wolfi/git@2.38.1-r0?arch=x86_64"
        }
      ],
      "status": "not_affected",
      "justification": "inline_mitigations_already_exist"
    }
  ]
}

Note: If you’re still overwhelmed despite having minimal dependencies, it might be worth considering more complex solutions like the CVE Prioritizer. This project offers advanced methods to help manage and prioritize CVEs effectively.

Conclusion

Adopting a zero CVE strategy is crucial for securing your software, and it all starts with minimizing CVE fatigue. We’ve all heard that “Security shouldn’t be an afterthought” and to “Shift left”! It’s time to apply these principles in our software development processes by following the proven strategies we’ve outlined.

By reducing dependencies, keeping them up-to-date, using a single package manager, and effectively prioritizing vulnerabilities, you can mitigate the risks associated with CVE fatigue.

This proactive approach not only lightens the workload on security teams but also ensures that vulnerabilities are promptly addressed, maintaining a secure software environment. We urge you to check out projects like BuildSafe that aim to make security by default extremely easy. Let’s make security a fundamental part of our software development process and ensure our systems are robust and secure from the start.

随着软件复杂性的增加和数字威胁的演变（如 我们之前的博客）在当今的数字时代，组织面临着数量激增的问题安全漏洞。根据2024 年联盟网络威胁指数，我们预计今年常见漏洞和暴露 (CVE) 数量将增加 25%，达到近 34,888 个 - 这是一个令人震惊的数字！

CVE 的如此增加给 IT 专业人员带来了重大挑战，他们必须不断识别、确定优先级并修复这些漏洞。这个过程通常相当令人难以承受，通常被称为“CVE 疲劳”，可能会导致漏掉漏洞并增加网络攻击的风险。

在本博客中，我们将深入研究 CVE 疲劳的主要原因，并讨论一些可最大程度减少 CVE 疲劳的可行策略。因此，引导组织走向更加受控和安全的环境。

什么是 CVE 疲劳？

如果您还不熟悉 CVE 一词，它代表常见漏洞和暴露。这些是已知软件和硬件漏洞的标准化标识符。 CVE 系统的目的是提供一种标准化的方法来识别和描述漏洞，使组织更轻松地确定安全问题的优先级并解决安全问题。

有关 CVE 的更多详细信息，您可以参阅文章。

另一方面，CVE 疲劳是一个常见术语，用于描述开发人员和 IT 专业人员由于行业中不断引入需要立即关注的新 CVE 的不断涌入而经历的压倒性感觉。这种不断发现新漏洞并快速修复的过程可能会导致倦怠和被忽视的问题，从而增加安全漏洞的风险。

说明 CVE 疲劳后果的一个值得注意的事件是 2017 Equifax 数据泄露。在此漏洞中，攻击者利用了一个已知漏洞 (CVE-2017 -5638) 在Apache Struts 框架。尽管该漏洞的补丁已经发布数月，但未能及时应用，导致约 1.479 亿人的敏感个人信息被泄露。

Equifax 漏洞是 CVE 疲劳的主要例子之一，因为该公司的安全团队可能因需要关注的漏洞数量过多而不知所措，从而导致修复关键漏洞的延迟。此事件强调了有效漏洞管理的重要性以及 CVE 疲劳的可怕后果。

您知道吗？

减少 CVE 疲劳的行之有效的策略

CVE 疲劳对许多组织来说是一项重大挑战，由几个关键问题引起。通过了解根本原因并应用经过验证的策略，我们可以有效缓解此问题。

使用最小依赖项

每年发布的 CVE 数量之多足以让安全团队不知所措。由于有数千个新漏洞需要评估和解决，安全团队正在被需要立即关注的警报淹没。如此高的数量使得难以跟上，导致响应延迟和潜在的疏忽。

查看CVE 统计数据和事实请参阅报告，了解有关 2019 年至 2024 年期间 CVE 增长的更多信息。

从一开始就减少依赖项的数量可以显着减少潜在漏洞的数量。对于许多公司和发行版来说，常见的做法是从通用 Linux 映像开始，然后去掉不需要的东西。

注意：DockerSlim 的作用就是获取现有映像并删除不必要的组件。

虽然这种方法会导致主发行版的版本较小，例如Ubuntu mini< /a>，更有效的方法是从一开始就只添加必要的依赖项。为此，您可以使用 Distroless 等最小基础映像，但事实并非如此使用这种方法可以简单地添加或删除操作系统包。即使是很小的依赖也可能导致重大违规！而且，如果开发人员在这些最小映像中找不到他们需要的包，他们通常会切换到更大的映像，而不是仅添加他们需要的操作系统包。

Talos Linux 与其他包含数百个二进制文件的系统相比，只包含 12 个二进制文件，这是这一策略的一个很好的例子，因为它从头开始设计，只包含需要的内容。这种方法限制了攻击面并减轻了安全团队的负担。

注意：如果您想知道如何完全控制应用所需的操作系统软件包，请查看BuildSafe 开始使用。

拥有依赖更新机制

有效管理软件依赖性对于解决 CVE 疲劳和最小化漏洞至关重要。使用声明性格式的依赖项有助于消除隐式行为问题。声明性依赖项管理可以清楚地显示正在使用哪些依赖项，从而更轻松地跟踪和更新它们。通过在配置文件中显式声明所有依赖项，团队可以轻松管理和自动化更新，确保所有组件都是最新且安全的。 Dependabot 等工具通过检查过时的依赖项并创建拉取请求来更新它们来自动执行此过程。

但是，需要注意的是，Dependabot 无法处理操作系统包更新，因为项目通常不会以声明方式定义操作系统依赖项。这种不一致使得跟踪和更新它们变得困难，从而导致出现未被注意到的安全漏洞。此外，很少有包管理器（例如 Nix）以声明方式定义每个项目的操作系统依赖项，这使得依赖管理中持续存在的挑战。

注意：BuildSafe 团队正在开发 GitHub 机器人来解决此问题操作系统依赖性。如果您有兴趣，可以加入 Discord 服务器来请求访问 Alpha 版本！

你知道吗？
Repology，一个跟踪多个项目的包装信息的项目存储库，显示包管理中的碎片。这种碎片凸显了不同存储库处理包的方式以及使用多个包管理器的低效率。

值得注意的是，Nix 因拥有最大的软件包生态系统之一而脱颖而出潜在 CVE 最少，凸显其稳健性和安全性！

使用单个包管理器和自动修补

管理多个软件包生态系统可能会让安全团队不堪重负，导致效率低下和补丁延迟。

在整个组织中强制使用单个包管理器可以简化依赖关系管理。单个包管理器提供了统一的生态系统，使安全团队更容易跟踪和更新依赖项。例如，当出现 CVE 并且安全团队负责修补关键任务软件时，他们通常需要将补丁发送到上游软件包存储库。想象一下，如果您和您的团队必须为五个不同的软件包生态系统执行此操作，每个生态系统都有自己的构建配方和特定要求，因为一个 CVE – 多么噩梦！

理想情况下，随着公司的发展，目标应该是拥有一个内部包注册表，其中依赖项在开发人员使用之前由安全团队进行审查。这些内部存储库可以镜像公共存储库，同时通过安全检查和自动更新策略添加和维护其他软件包。这种方法不仅降低了安全团队的复杂性和工作量，而且还确保所有依赖项得到一致的管理和安全。

想法：
想象一下如果我们可以在开发和运行时环境中共享包管理器会带来什么好处。 Nix，一个强大的包管理器允许我们做到这一点，但更多内容将在以后的文章中介绍.

例如，Wolfi Chainguard 开发的就是一个很好的例子。 Wolfi 是一个专注于无 CVE 的发行版，并已获得 Docker 可信发布者的地位。

优先考虑漏洞管理

确定首先解决哪些漏洞可能很复杂，因为并非所有 CVE 都会带来相同级别的风险。需要考虑受影响系统的重要性、潜在影响和严重性。

您可以通过请求漏洞利用交换 来自软件包管理器生态系统内安全公告的 (VEX) 文档。这些文档有助于消除伪造的 CVE，并提供有关漏洞的准确信息。可以使用 Kubescape< 等工具生成 VEX 文档/a>，它利用 eBPF 监控系统调用并确定特定 CVE 的相关性。
